**tl;dr**
Looks like my installation of VS/msbuild is really messed up. I'll try to reinstall everything starting with Windows, but I can't do it until next week (I'm DRI this week and can't afford to ruin my laptop).

The error I get from msbuild is 

`Can't find C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V110\Microsoft.Cpp.Default.props`

On my machine it's located either at `C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\V140` or
at `C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\Microsoft.Cpp\v4.0\`. The path in vcxproj (which we're not changing) is `$(VCTargetsPath)\Microsoft.Cpp.Default.props`, so evidently my `VCTargetsPath` is wrong. If I try to set it to correct version via msbuild command line params, this error finally disappears but two new appear.

```
C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\build.props(120,5): error MSB4175: The task factory "CodeTaskFactory" could not be loaded f
rom the assembly "C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\14.0\bin\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.v4.0.dll". Could not load file or assem
bly 'file:///C:\Program Files (x86)\MSBuild\14.0\bin\Microsoft.Build.Tasks.v4.0.dll' or one of its dependencies. The sy
stem cannot find the file specified. [C:\incubator-reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge\Org.Apache.REEF.Bridge.vcxproj]
```

I can find `Microsoft.Build.Tasks.v4.0.dll` only at `C:\Program Files (x86)\Reference Assemblies\Microsoft\Framework\.NETFramework`, why it goes for msbuild folder, I don't know.

`error TRK0005: Failed to locate: "CL.exe". The system cannot find the file specified.`

`CL.exe` should be in `C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\bin` but it's just not there.
Second commit fixes link in commit message (JIRA number)

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #565](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/565/) ABORTED
Oh, if so, I agree with your opinion. I will change REEF-774 and this PR according to your guide. Thank you, @johnyangk .

@johnyangk . I updated JIRA issue and this PR. I hope this PR is proper and enough for now. Thank you again for your quick help.

This PR removes Serializable interface from Tasklet class
since Tasklet class is not designed for serialization.
This also resolves a high-priority findbug warning
between Tasklet and VortexFuture class.

JIRA:
   [REEF-774](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-774)

Pull Request:
  This closes #512
@dongjoon-hyun No problem. Thank you for fixing the bug! I'll do the merge.

@anupam128 After doing a deep clean, it seems like although the error above still appears during submission, the job does turn to "running" state. Given that the CR is orthogonal to the error, I will be merging this PR. I will follow up on the error on the dev mailing list. Thanks!

@anupam128 Actually, it seems like this is expected, as seen in YarnJobSubmissionClient.java, though the error messages do seem misleading, as it never writes a success message. I will revisit the logic later to understand exactly what it is trying to do. Sorry for the confusion!

Debug build is broken after sync the change from master. 

(CoreCompile target) ->
  Properties\AssemblyInfo.cs(59,31): error CS1726: Friend assembly reference 'Org.Apache.REEF.Tests' is invalid. Strong-name signed assemblies must specify a public key in their InternalsVisibleTo declarations. [D:\Reef\ReefApache\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.csproj]

Strong-name signed assemblies must specify a public key in their InternalsVisibleTo declarations. [D:\Reef\ReefApache\reef\lang\cs\Org.Apache.REEF.Client\Org.Apache.REEF.Client.csproj]
